Kiling Floor is a very good survival first person shooter. Its is also a very fun game to play with friends and strangers alike. You will find yourself freaking out when you get mauled by a Fleshpound but still enjoying every moment of it.

This game focuses mostly on multiplayer. You can do single player, but it is likely you'll be overwhelmed. It is a surival horror themed game. It feels mostly like a polished mod with one typed of gameplay which is what it is. On a give map, you get money for shooting monsters and surviving a wave. You use that money to buy better weapons, get armor, and ammo. There are usually 10 waves. Each wave has more monsters and progressively tougher ones added. There are several classes that offer perks such as discounts on weapons, increased damage, or more ammo per clip on a certain type of weapon. You can level up each class to get increased benefits. I have found that the normal difficulty is harder than what I would expect in a normal difficulty. Since the game is a bit repetitive and only features a survival mode, I would give it a 6-7/10. I got it for 90% off, so the price was worth it at the time. I woudln't get it unless you have friends who play it and it's on a decent sale.

什么是KF呢？
KILLING FLOOR是一款合作对抗生存CO-OP游戏。不同于L4D这种一路闯关的CO-OP，KF是一款在地图上在ZEDS（变异体）进攻下坚守至某一波并最终消灭BOSS的CO-OP生存游戏。
游戏中有多种职业，拥有不同加成和技能。合理运用自己职业的优势与队友配合并且击杀BOSS获得胜利的快感是很不错的。
游戏中各种变异体形象分明，能力突出，让人第一眼见到就不会忘记他们的形象。
KF这款游戏的乐趣就在于合作，事实上TWI这个工作室所出品的游戏，都很强调合作，无论是RO RO2 还是KF，合作的乐趣往往大于一个人单打独斗。
本游戏和师出同门的RO一样，都属于MOD版本延伸至独立版本。都经历过简化如果你想体验最早的KF（很难），那就去尝试寻找KF2005吧O.O 从变化你就能看出TWI的用心了。
PS:KF2快点出预购嘛QAQ，我要买买买！！！

Um dos poucos jogos que realmente recomendo. Killing Floor queridamente apelidado de "KF" entre os jogadores, é, como já diz no seu subtitulo, um CO-OP de terror e sobrevivencia. O jogo não tem os melhores gráficos, mas tem uma jogabilidade fudidamente boa, onde você e seus amiguinhos podem se reunir parar fuzilar zumbis, explodir zumbis, arrancar cabeças de zumbis e etc. Além de contar com classes "upaveis" conta com uma variedade de armas. Além de tudo isso, tem o ZED time, que é um "momento drmatico", em que o jogo fica em camera lenta. 
O jogo tem uma trilha sonora que combina com cada momento, e são musicas fodas de mais.

P.S: Se quem é berseker lv 4 pra baxo e entra em servidor hard pra cima, é um lixo humano :3

Fun co-op survival game to play with friends or alone online with random people. More fun as a group or as a lan game but would recommend it to most survival zombie/infected game. Lots of weapons, lots of maps, nice variety of roles to play and level up to unlock things. The money system keeps the game fun and the slow-mo adds to the awesomeness sometimes. Most DLC is character skins even if theres some DLC guns, but the Toy Master free DLC is a must for any owner of the base game.

"I play it all the time. Obviously get it."

Since TRIPWIRE has recently seen fit to promote a free weekend and sale for a Killing Floor 2 update, I think now is a good time to rewrite my review for the first Killing Floor. I have played just a few hours of this game and obtained a few of the achievements, so it's easy to say this is still in my favorite games list. However, I am now more aware of some of this game's more frustrating aspects that are worth noting before playing. Namely, the spawn system. It is still leagues above Killing Floor 2's teleporting zeds, but it has its own problems. There are plenty of places on maps for zeds to spawn that are inaccessible to the player for them to spend some time moving to the main map area before you have to worry about them, but there are also plenty of instances of a group of zeds spawning too close to the player's current position. In some cases, I have experienced six clots suddenly dropping right on top of my head in places they had no place to drop from other than spawning in the air. Large groups of dangerous zeds have a habit of spawning too close to the player, especially at the beginning of a wave. This becomes a problem since a player's current position in relation to the zeds' is the most important factor in a round's success. This problem is less apparent in multiplayer co op than in solo play. You'll have to spend the first minute of each wave kiting the map around zeds until you are certain that all of the spawns are on one side of you before you can safely engage them. The other problem that can impede the experience is hitbox quality. Headshots are another important aspect of gameplay, and zeds can frequently hop up and down over pieces of debris or change their vertical position briefly while navigating the terrain. You'll have to be very careful about judging the zeds' current headshot positions since they shift so frequently and often unpredictably.

These problems can be considered a learning curve, and while they can be a hindrance, they can still be adapted to and overcome. At that point, the fun factor and satisfaction of the game shines through. Every weapon looks and sounds fantastic and zeds splatter and explode in chunky and gory glory. As the game amps up in the difficulty you select and later waves, it evolves into a ballet of rapid and intense decision making: which zed in a crowd you target, where you decide to run, which weapons you purchase and use, every decision is the difference between success and failure. You have to learn each zed's behavior and patterns and every weapon's strengths and weaknesses to survive as you use rapid combo techniques to take down the largest and most dangerous zeds as well as large packs. Zeds will work together to use their abilities, so players must also work together to support and cover each other as the number of zeds increases with the number of players in a game.

So, the game is challenging and a lot of fun. However, there are many weapons and characters behind an additional paywall. This is frustrating, since some of these weapons are key for certain playstyles and strategies, and some are just silly. I don't want to encourage TRIPWIRE's price gouging, so just start with the base game and only get a few additional paid weapons if you REALLY want them. Avoid the stupid gold and neon weapons (unlike me). The base game is still plenty strong enough for a strong recommendation.

Killing Floor is a FPS where your only objective is to make it through each wave of Zeds and live. Despite having only 2 game modes, Normal and Objective, Killing Floor will provide you with hours upon hours of action and fun. 

You can play as 7 different 'Perks' (another name for classes) each with a variety or weapons and buffs to their respective perks. 

Highly recommend this game to either play alone or with friends.

Killing Floor is one of those games that never gets old no matter how many times you play it. It's addicting, tense (espiscelly with the Hell on Earth difficulty), action-packed, pretty good FPS, and you gotta love that terrible yet tolerable voice acting. The only downside is the amount of servers there is anymore. In 2011-2015 there would be up to 200 servers, but now all I can get is 20 at the highest, shame to see such a great game lose its playerbase in that amount of time, but I digress. So basically, buy the game now before everyone's gone.
